alert.note: Alert for Frederick (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 07 at 9:05PM EDT until May 08 at 12:09PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Maryland... Monocacy River near Frederick affecting Frederick County. For the Monocacy River...including Frederick...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Monocacy River near Frederick. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Significant lowland flooding is occurring along the river, with backwater flooding also occurring. Numerous roads are closed. Water is approaching the parking lot at Gambrill Mill on the Monocacy National Battlefield. Backwater flooding from Carroll Creek is likely approaching the underside of the bridge leading to the Frederick city wastewater treatment plant. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 17.3 feet, or 2.3 feet above flood stage. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 PM EDT Saturday was 17.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling to 5.2 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.3 feet on 12/05/1950. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && River Name Fld Observed Sun Sun Sun Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 2AM 8AM 2PM Stg Time Date Monocacy River Frederick 15.0 17.3 Sat 8 pm 15.9 14.6 13.2 MSG unknown &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/washington or www.weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 915 AM EDT.
